template.p: Setting up a Point of Sale (POS) system for a grocery store which is essential for efficiently managing various product categories, handling transactions, and providing excellent customer service. Grocery stores are businesses that carry a large selection of products like Food Grains, Oil & Clarified Butter, Dry Fruits, Chocolates, Snacks & Packaged Food with multiple variants etc… Here's a step-by-step guide to setting up a POS system for a grocery store or a supermarket:
In the retail store, we set up the POS module for B2C customers and sales for B2B customers. They use the Sales, Purchase, Inventory, Accounting modules.

Flow 3: Point of sale - Customer Account
Flow 4: Point of Sale - Ship Later & Global discount @10%

ul.li: Create an RFQ for "Grocery outlet"
Select a product (e.g toothpaste)
Confirm the RFQ
Validate the reception for all quantities at once.

h2.strong: Flow 2: Point of sale - Regular flow with Buy one get one free product

template.p: For the Small Products, orders & payments are made at the shop itself, and the customer picks up the products directly.

p.strong: To do that, open the Point of Sale application:

ul.li: Create a POS order with the required product (i.e. ‘Daawat Traditional Basmati Rice)and (Colgate Maxfresh with cooling crystals Toothpaste — 600g – Pack of 4)
Click on the “Reward” Button then after automatic Free product add “‘Toothbrush Ultrasoft[Pack of 4].
Then pay the order.

h2.strong: Flow 3: Point of sale - Customer Account

template.p: The concept is simple from the POS screen itself, When a customer purchases a product on credit, it means they take the product without making an immediate payment. Instead, they owe a certain amount to the shop. The customer returns to the shop at a later date to pay the remaining amount they owe for the product, settling the debt.

p.strong: To do that, open the Point of Sale application:

ul.li: Create a POS order with the required product (i.e.Maggie Mega Pack” – 70g - Pack of 4, Sunfeast Dark Fantasy Choco Fills Cream – 600g - Pack of 4)
Then click on Payment, we can add a “customer account” i.e put in some money as the credit balance.
Validate your order.

h2.strong: Flow 4: Point of Sale - Ship Later & Global discount @10%

template.p: For large or Bulk products, the order & payment is done at the shop, but the delivery is sometimes scheduled later.

p.strong: To do that, open the Point of Sale application:

ul.li: Create a POS order with heavy products (i.e. Almonds(American), Cadbury Oreo Biscuit Vanilla Flavour Cream)
​Give the Global Discount @ 10%
Set the customer to define the shipping address
As it's set an invoice and mark "Ship Later"
Then pay the order

template.p: Customers can book the order, or ask for a quote, on the phone at the shop, but the customer picks up and pays for the products at the store when they are available.

p.strong: To do that, start with a Quotation order:

ul.li: Create a quotation and send it by email
Optionally: the customer might confirm the order, but it's not necessary
When the customer goes to the store, from the POS Order, use the button "Quotation / Order" to load the related Sales order
Settle the order from the POS screen to record the payment and give products to the customer.

template.p: If customers opt to disassemble packages within the shop, the packaging feature becomes essential. For instance, when selecting a Monster Energy drink bottles are in packs of 5 and 10 in the shelves:

p.strong: To do that, open the Point of sale application:

ul.li: Scanning the pack's barcode is necessary to determine the accurate price and decrease the inventory by six units.
If a customer chooses a single bottle from the pack, the barcode of that bottle must be scanned instead.
